note.p: Burial: The chancel of Berkeley parish church, Gloucestershire
Research Field: Natural history, immunology, medicine
Education: Pupil of John Hunter (FRS 1767), St George's Hospital, London (1770)

Career: Settled in medical practice in Berkeley (1773); his discovery of vaccination against small pox, practised on James Phipps (1796) was included in his publication "Inquiry into the causes and effects of variolae vaccinae" (1798); petitioned Parliament and received a grant of Â£10,000 for his discovery (1802)
